Package org.opensextant.giscore.geometry

Class Geometry

java.lang.Object
org.opensextant.giscore.geometry.Geometry
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IGISObject, VisitableGeometry, IDataSerializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GeometryBag, GeometryBase, Model, MultiLine, MultiLinearRings, MultiPoint, MultiPolygons
public abstract class Geometry extends Object implements VisitableGeometry, IGISObject, IDataSerializable, Serializable
The Geometry abstract class is the basis for all geometric objects in the geometry package.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

      public Geometry()

  • Method Details

    • is3D

      public boolean is3D()
      This method returns a boolean indicating if this geometry object is 3-dimensional (false means it is based on only Geodetic surface coordinates of Longitude and Latitude, while true means the points also contain elevation values in meters).
      Returns:
      true if elevation values are included in the point data, false otherwise.

    • getBoundingBox

      @Nullable public @Nullable Geodetic2DBounds getBoundingBox()
      This method returns the Geodetic2DBounds that encloses this Geometry object.
      Returns:
      Geodetic2DBounds object enclosing this Geometry object.

    • computeBoundingBox

      protected abstract void computeBoundingBox()
      Compute a bounding box from the data for this geometry object. This is called if getBoundingBox() is called and the bounding box is not set. This may be true if the object is initialized or if the object is copied over a network connection or has been otherwise serialized.

    • getNumParts

      public abstract int getNumParts()
      This method returns the number of separate parts of the Geometry object. The count of parts corresponds to the count of parts for use in creating ESRI Shapefiles.
      Returns:
      integer number of separate parts that make up this Geometry object.

    • getNumPoints

      public abstract int getNumPoints()
      This method returns the total number of points in all the parts of this Geometry object.
      Returns:
      integer number of total points in all the parts of this Geometry object.

    • getCenter

      public Geodetic2DPoint getCenter()
      This method returns a Geodetic2DPoint or Geodetic3DPoint that is at the center of this Geometry object's Bounding Box or null if the bounding box is not defined.
      Returns:
      Geodetic2DPoint or Geodetic3DPoint at the center of this Geometry object

    • containerOf

      public boolean containerOf(Geometry otherGeom)
      Tests whether this geometry is a container of another geometry such as MultiPolygon is a container of Polygons, MultiPoint is a container of Point, etc.
      Parameters:
      otherGeom - the geometry from which to test if this is a container for
      Returns:
      true if the geometry of this object is a "proper" container for otherGeom. Features Point, Line, LinearRing, Polygon are treated as primitive features and not considered "proper" containers though Lines contain points, polygons contain LinearRings, etc. By default return false and override only for container Geometries (e.g. MultiPolygon, MultiPoint, etc.)

    • toString

      public abstract String toString()
      The toString method returns a String representation of this object suitable for debugging
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String containing Geometry object type, bounding coordinates, and number of parts.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      This method using reflection to determine whether two Geometries are equal.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - Geometry to compare against this one.
      Returns:
      true if specified Geometry is equal in value to this Geometry.

    • readData

      public void readData(SimpleObjectInputStream in) throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException, InstantiationException, IllegalAccessException
      Description copied from interface: IDataSerializable
      Read object from the data stream.

      Note other exceptions such as ClassCastException or NullPointerException and others could be thrown if the order of writeData() calls does not match the corresponding readData() calls for the same classes.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      Throws:
